meanings.definition: To make or become denser or more compact.
meanings.sent1: The snow densified as the temperature dropped, turning into ice.
meanings.sent2: She densified the soil by adding more clay to the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The magician densified the fog, making it easier to disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent4: His words densified the tension in the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The artist densified the colors on the canvas, creating a bold and striking painting.

meanings.definition: To increase the density of something.
meanings.sent1: The factory densified the plastic to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: They densified the population in the city by building more apartments.
meanings.sent3: The chef densified the soup, making it so thick you could stand a spoon in it.
meanings.sent4: Her presence densified the atmosphere, making everyone feel her energy.
meanings.sent5: The scientist densified the liquid, turning it into a solid in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The densified wood was perfect for building sturdy furniture.
meanings.sent2: The densified snow made it difficult to walk through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The densified cake was so heavy, it almost broke the plate.
meanings.sent4: The densified fog obscured the view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The densified crowd at the concert made it hard to move around.
